bibl.title: "Strouthos - pdd", an Example of a Bilingual Nickname (Reconsideration of SB I 5441).
bibl.note: The genitive "Strouthou" (instead of "ophuthou") in the Greek text of S.B. I, 5441 (= C.E.M.G. 1730) is the exact equivalent of the Egyptian nickname that means "the sparrow."
Derda Tomasz, "Strouthos - pdd", an Example of a Bilingual Nickname (Reconsideration of SB I 5441).
